San Rafael, CA 4/6/2012 I have given this place 3 tries...
Giant burgers? Really, giant? No they are regular size (I'm a 125lb woman with a healthy size appetite), they are pretty good except they always come well done and they are crazy expensive for what you get (because its not much). The service is awful. Most of the seats are torn and the place is always dirty. I normally go when its not that busy, maybe one other table, yet all the tables are dirty/not busted and there is garbage on the floor. There always seems to be enough staff, but they are hanging out and feeding their friends/family and not doing any work. Seriously like a total of 6 people working, one at the counter being RUDE when you try to place an order and one taking FOREVER to make your order and then 4 standing around. I feel bad for whoever is shelling out the money for these people to stand around.
Overall the food is fine, if you have a coupon and want a dirty McDonalds atmosphere with bad customer service.

Novato, CA 10/1/2011 I ordered two burgers, fries, onion rings and a milkshake for take out. While waiting for my food, I saw another customer picking up her called in order leave with her bag of food and come back not a minute later asking for the rest of her order - another burger and fries, neither of which had been made.
I thought to myself that they couldn't possibly do that twice in a row. I was wrong.
I checked my order before leaving (thankfully) and noticed I was also missing one burger and the one order of fries. I brought this to their attention and they made the extra burger (and I thought!) fries and I went on my way without checking the bag. My fault, yes, but COME ON. When I got home with one (now!) cold burger, one warm burger, cold onion rings and a melting shake, I noticed the fries were still missing. Instead of going back to get them I decided I'd just not go back there again.
The burgers were a disaster - half cooked, sloppy and oily (how they managed to get burgers oily is beyond me) - and the onion rings weren't much better. They were also sopping in oil. The only decent but not great thing was the shake.
I won't be going back.

Novato, CA 6/8/2008 7 Check-ins Here ROTD 1/4/2009 As the name says, Phyllis's is a great place to stop for a huge burger. The portions are large, and that's a good thing because the burgers are delicious!
All sandwiches can be substituted for a piece of grilled chicken or a vegan burger. They've got a bunch of different things you can add to spruce up your burger like avocado, sauteed mushrooms or onions, chili or even pesto.
I opted for the pepper-jack 1/2lb burger which comes with pepper-jack cheese, avocado, sprouts, a chipotle sauce and served on a ciabatta bun. At first I was skeptical if ordering "just the burger" would be enough to eat for lunch. But moments after eating the burger I would be thrown in one of the heaviest food comas I have ever been in. It was so intense I was left speechless except to mutter "I'm ruined!" over and over.
In the midst of this debilitating yet somewhat happy food coma, I noticed Phyllis' has an outdoor patio area and a bar towards the back that probably serves beer.
Great lunch spot, pretty reasonable prices for great burgers.

Monterey, CA 19/5/2010 This place is some sort of weird hybrid between a sit down restaurant and a fast food joint.
We ordered our burgers and various side dishes and I ordered a pint of IPA too. After a minute or so, back up to the counter area to pick up my pint (which came in a pint glass).
After a while our number is called and we go back up to the counter to grab our trays. After some confusion as to which burger was which, we started to eat.
I had the Teriyaki burger and onion rings - the burger was pretty decent, and typically messy for that kind of burger - and the onion rings were OK (nothing special).
The IPA was a Lagunitas on tap - always good!
The weird part of this hybrid fast food/sit down style is folks were busing their own tables, and the normal fast food trash cans are by the doors, but in your typical fast food joint, everything but the tray goes in the trash.
Here, you have the tray, baskets, bowls and the afore mentioned pint glass that don't need to go into the trash, and then there's various basket liners etc. that do - it's all rather complicated and messy.
We didn't quite get it right in that a chili bowl accidentaly ended up in the trash.
If this place could figure out the level of service (and maybe move it up a notch), it could easily become a four star place, but with its current split personality, it gets a three.

Novato, CA 3/6/2011 Where to start.....
Let me first note that this is my very first post on Yelp and I felt compelled to do so because this place was such a horrible experience. Do not let this place fool you by its cosmetics with flat screen tv's inside. This location has been plagued with sub-par chains. I thought this place was finally the savior for this location......BUT I was wrong.
Their food I have to admit is at best decent. The cashiers ask you how you want your burger, and well it doesn't matter if you ask for it rare, medium, or well. THEY ALL COME OUT WELL. I have been here a couple times and have always ordered the Western on a french roll. The french roll is definitely the way to go if you decide to take your chances and eat at this place.
Now you might wonder why I would give this place a one star review if the food is at least decent. Well.....their customer service is nothing short of awful. I've been here three times and had my order messed up all three times. I gave them the benefit of the doubt this team. Could they really mess up my order for a 3rd time!? I drive all the way home, sit down on my nice comfy couch and check my order (my fault). What were the chances of them messing up my order once again? F@#$ me!! Again!!!?? I call the dumb broken english cashier who took my order and complained that they had once again messed up my order. I ordered curly fries NOT french fries. The lady told me to come back with the french fries so she could switch them out for the curly fries. First of all, they can't even give me these french fries out of courtesy for jacking up my order!? What is she going to give them to another customer? Munch on them behind counter? I finally drive back to the restaurant and the lady is giving me attitude. I ask for the manager and the idiot doesn't even know who or where her manager is.
Ironically while I'm going back and forth with this numb nuts, the other cashier screws up another lady's ice cream order! You would think you were at a fast food restaurant.
I pitifully drove back home and ate my cold, fat coagulated burger with hot curly fries.....
Sorry Yelpers for the long review, I couldn't resist. And if the owners are reading, they need to know how terrible their customer service is and maybe think twice about hiring incompetent people at minimum wage. I am not the first on here to complain about their atrocious service paired with sub-par food.
